verses.verse: (For the choir director; according to Shushan <S%H7802><s%> Eduth. A Mikhtam of David, to) (teach; when he struggled with Aram-naharaim and with Aram-zobah, and Joab) (returned, and smote twelve thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt.) O God, <S%H430><s%> Thou hast rejected <S%H2186><s%> us. Thou hast broken <S%H6555><s%> us; Thou hast been <S%H599><s%> angry; <S%H599><s%> O, restore <S%H7725><s%> us.
Thou hast made the land <S%H776><s%> quake, <S%H7493><s%> Thou hast split <S%H6480><s%> it open; <S%H6480><s%> Heal <S%H7495><s%> its breaches, <S%H7667><s%> for it totters. <S%H4131><s%>

Thou hast made Thy people <S%H5971><s%> experience <S%H7200><s%> hardship; <S%H7186><s%> Thou hast given <S%H8248><s%> us wine <S%H3196><s%> to drink <S%H8248><s%> that makes us stagger. <S%H8653><s%>

Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> a banner <S%H5251><s%> to those who fear <S%H3372><s%> Thee, That it may be displayed <S%H5264><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the truth. <S%H9534><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
That Thy beloved <S%H3039><s%> may be delivered, <S%H2502><s%> Save <S%H3467><s%> with Thy right <S%H3225><s%> hand, <S%H3225><s%> and answer <S%H6030><s%> us!

God <S%H430><s%> has spoken <S%H1696><s%> in His holiness: <S%H6944><s%> "I will exult, <S%H5937><s%> I will portion <S%H2505><s%> out Shechem <S%H7927><s%> and measure <S%H4058><s%> out the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Succoth. <S%H5523><s%>
"Gilead <S%H1568><s%> is Mine, and Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> is Mine; Ephraim <S%H669><s%> also is the helmet <S%H4581><s%> of My head; <S%H7218><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> is My scepter. <S%H2710><s%>

"Moab <S%H4124><s%> is My washbowl <S%H7366><s%>; <S%H5518><s%> Over <S%H5921><s%> Edom <S%H9000><s%> I shall throw <S%H7993><s%> My shoe; <S%H5275><s%> Shout <S%H7321><s%> loud, <S%H7321><s%> O Philistia, <S%H6429><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> of Me!"
Who <S%H4310><s%> will bring <S%H2986><s%> me into the besieged <S%H4692><s%> city <S%H5892><s%>? Who <S%H4310><s%> will lead <S%H5148><s%> me to Edom <S%H9000><s%>?
Hast not Thou Thyself, <S%H859><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> rejected <S%H2186><s%> us? And wilt Thou not go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> with our armies, <S%H6635><s%> O God <S%H430><s%>?
O give <S%H3051><s%> us help <S%H5833><s%> against <S%H4480><s%> the adversary, <S%H6862><s%> For deliverance <S%H8668><s%> by man <S%H120><s%> is in vain. <S%H7723><s%>
Through God <S%H430><s%> we shall do <S%H6213><s%> valiantly, <S%H2428><s%> And it is He who will tread <S%H947><s%> down <S%H947><s%> our adversaries. <S%H6862><s%>
